intro: Exochorda davidiana, commonly known as the David's snowball bush, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It is characterized by its clusters of white, fluffy flowers that bloom in early spring, giving it a snowball-like appearance. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are usually dark green and slightly hairy. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden landscapes.
